description: CHANGE OF USE OF EXISTING C3 (DWELLINGHOUSE) USE TO MIXED C3 (DWELLINGHOUSE) / F1 (DAY NURSERY/CHILD MINDING) (SUI GENERIS USE) TO ALLOW FOR MAXIMUM 15 CHILDREN
decision_conditions: Reason : 1 - The proposed development would result in the loss of a family-sized residential dwelling for which insufficient justification has been given and a need for the proposed day care facility has not been adequately demonstrated.  As such, the proposed change of use is considered contrary to Merton LDF Core Planning Strategy (2011) Policy CS9 and the London Plan (2021) Policy H8.

Reason : 2 - The proposal, by reason of its proposed change of use, would result in the increase of noise levels at the site, which in the absence of a noise impact assessment would have the potential to be harmful to the amenity of the surrounding residential occupiers. This would be contrary to Merton's Sites and Policies Plan (2014) Policies DMC1, DMD2, DMEP2, DMR4 and the London Plan (2021) Policies D13 and D14.

Reason : 3 - In the absence of sufficient and satisfactory cycle parking provision, the development has failed to provide sufficient secure, integrated, convenient and accessible cycle parking facilities and thus fail to promote sustainable form of transport, contrary to, in particular, policy DMT1 of the Merton Sites and Policies Plan 2014 and T5 of the London Plan 2021.
Reason : 4 - The proposal has not provided adequate provisions for refuse storage and collection and is therefore contrary with Merton LDF Core Strategy (2011) policy CS 17

Reason : 5 - The proposed development fails to provide sufficient information to demonstrate that the vehicle movement likely to be generated by the proposed use could suitably be accommodated without detriment to the local on-street parking availability, congestion, road and pedestrian safety. This would be contrary to Merton's Sites and Policies Plan (2014) Policy DMT2, London Plan (2021) Policy T4 and Merton's Core Strategy Policy (2011) Policies CS18 and CS20.

Reason : 6 - In the absence of a site specific flood risk assessment including drainage strategy commensurate to the nature and scale of the development the scheme is considered to increase risk of flooding in the locality contrary to the aims and objections of, in particular, London Plan policy SI 13, Merton Core Strategy (2011) policy CS16 and Merton Sites and Policies Plan (2014) policies DM F1 and DM F2.

Reason : 7 - In the absence of an Air Quality Neutral Statement, it has not been demonstrated that the proposal would include measures in order to make the proposal Air Quality Neutral and provisions to achieve sustainable design and construction. The proposal therefore fails to comply with, in particular, policies SI 1,SI 2, SI 5 and SI 13 of the London Plan 2021 and policy CS15 of Merton's Core Planning Strategy 2011.

Reason : 8 - INFORMATIVE
Note to Applicant
In accordance with paragraph 38 of the NPPF, The London Borough of Merton  (LBM) takes a positive and proactive approach to development proposals focused on solutions. LBM works with applicants/agents in a positive and proactive manner by:
"	Offering a pre-application advice and duty desk service. 
"	Where possible, suggesting solutions to secure a successful outcome.
"	As appropriate, updating applicants/agents of any issues that may arise in the processing of their application.
In this instance:
"	The application was not considered to comply with the provisions of the Development Plan and NPPF as submitted, and would have required substantial changes such that a new application would be required. 
"	The application was considered to be fundamentally contrary to the provisions of the Development Plan and the NPPF, and there were not considered to be any solutions to resolve this conflict. 
"	It is noted that the applicant/agent did not engage in any pre-application discussions.
"	The applicant is advised to seek pre-application advice on any resubmission.
